biogHist.abstract: Kalgoorlie Photos is a file held in the Children's Homes Files series at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. This lever-arch file contains information and images relating to the activities of the Salvation Army Corps in Kalgoorlie-Boulder, and includes some information and images relating to the Salvation Army Girls' Home ('The Fold'), Kalgoorlie (Lamington).
biogHist.p: Access to most items in the file is open, but it is essential to make an appointment to view.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Kalgoorlie Photos', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Kalgoorlie Photos file
archref.abstract: 'In the Army's Care' is a digital copy of an excerpt from an item held in the Kalgoorlie Photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The item is a booklet titled 'The Kalgoorlie Corps Golden Jubilee Celebrations May 30 - 1945 - June 3'. The item shows scenes from a Girl's Home which is likely to have been the Salvation Army Girls' Home, Kalgoorlie.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Kalgoorlie Photos file
archref.abstract: 'Kalgoorlie Girls' Dormitory' is a digital copy of an item held in the Kalgoorlie Photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The item is a photocopy of an image of a dormitory at the Salvation Army Girls' Home, Kalgoorlie. A typed note on the item says it was donated by Mrs EM Teede, and that the pillows are embroided with the words, 'Jesus Saves'. It is adjacent to a very poor photocopy of the same image, and a handwritten note dates the image to 1913, and gives its title as 'Dark Girls Dormitory', located in the Battye (State Library of Western Australia) at Call No. 727B.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Kalgoorlie Photos file
archref.abstract: 'Visit to Kalgoorlie' is a digital copy of an item held in the Kalgoorlie Photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The item is a photocopied excerpt from The War Cry dated 15 October 1921. The caption reports on a visit by the 'Subiaco Boys' and the presence of 'Girls from the Lamington Home'. These refer to the Salvation Army Boys' Home, West Subiaco (Nedlands) and the Salvation Army Girls' Home, Kalgoorlie (Lamington Heights).

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Our Children's Home at Kalgoorlie, W.A.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Kalgoorlie Photos file
archref.unittitle: Our Children's Home at Kalgoorlie, W.A.
archref.abstract: 'Our Children's Home at Kalgoorlie, W.A.' is a digital copy of an item held in the Kalgoorlie Photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The item is a photocopied excerpt from The War Cry dated 26 March 1921 and shows the building on a corner. A handwritten note reads, 'Lamington Heights', which was the Kalgoorlie suburb in which the Home was located, and 'Also known as The Fold'.
